item.title: Wheel Well Fire Detection System – EICAS Brake Temp NOT Available

remarks.para: May be inoperative deactivated provided brakes are verified cool to the touch before engine start.

numlitem.para: Verify brakes are cool before engine start by carefully touching each wheel’s brake to determine that each is cool.
After takeoff, avoid the possibility of retracting a wheel overheated from dragging brakes by leaving the landing gear extended for 10 minutes.

In case of engine failure after V1, performance is the prime consideration. Landing gear should be retracted until obstruction clearance requirement has been met, then extended for a 10 minute cooling period.
An additional 2,000 lbs. of fuel should be planned to account for increased fuel burn due to the landing gear being possibly extended for 10 minutes.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to FIRE/OVHT Test Switch: "WHEEL WELL FIRE DET INOP". Enter Item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: For dispatch with the Wheel Well Fire Detection System inoperative:

numlitem.para: To verify the brakes are cool before engine start, carefully touch each wheel’s brake to determine that each is cool.
Deactivate Flight Deck annunciations for Wheel Well Fire Warning by opening and collaring the P6 panel W/W FIRE DET AC circuit breaker.
